intro: Chevaliera crocophylla, commonly known as the golden crocus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, rhizomatous stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
